verses.verse: (Isa 45.20; Jer 50.2-4) Bel bows down; Nebo stoops; their idols are on beasts and cattle; these things you carry are loaded as burdens on weary animals.
(Jer 43.12, 13) They stoop; they bow down together; they cannot save the burden but themselves go into captivity.
(v 12|ISA 46:12; Isa 10.21, 22; 45.19; 63.9) Listen to me, O house of Jacob, all the remnant of the house of Israel, who have been borne by me from your birth, carried from the womb;
(Ps 71.18; Isa 43.13) even to your old age I am he; even when you turn gray I will carry you. I have made, and I will bear; I will carry and will save.
(Isa 40.18, 25) To whom will you liken me and make me equal and compare me, as though we were alike?
(Isa 40.19; 44.15, 17) Those who lavish gold from the purse and weigh out silver in the scales— they hire a goldsmith, who makes it into a god; then they fall down and worship!

(v 1|ISA 46:1; Isa 40.20; 41.26, 28; 44.17; 45.20) They lift it to their shoulders; they carry it; they set it in its place, and it stands there; it cannot move from its place. If one cries out to it, it does not answer or save anyone from trouble.
(Isa 44.19, 21; 48.8) Remember this and consider; (Meaning of Heb uncertain) recall it to mind, you transgressors;
(Isa 41.26, 27; 45.5, 21) remember the former things of old, for I am God, and there is no other; I am God, and there is no one like me,
(Isa 14.24; 45.21; Acts 5.39) declaring the outcome from the beginning and from ancient times things not yet done, saying, “My purpose shall stand, and I will fulfill my intention,”
(Isa 18.6; 37.26; 41.2, 25) calling a bird of prey from the east, the man for my purpose from a far country. I have spoken, and I will bring it to pass; I have planned, and I will do it.
(v 3|ISA 46:3; Isa 48.4; Jer 2.5) Listen to me, you stubborn of heart, you who are far from deliverance:
(Isa 43.7; 44.23; 61.11) I bring near my deliverance; it is not far off, and my salvation will not tarry; I will put salvation in Zion, for Israel my glory.
